intro: Argemone aenea, commonly known as the copperleaf or copper plant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces striking yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its seeds are encased in a hard, spiny capsule, and the plant is known for its ability to thrive in arid and rocky environments. Argemone aenea is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
